top_5.name: Identify Potential
top_5.description: Uncover, discover and harness realized or unrealized potential.

drivers.dig: Can see beyond surface qualities to underlying potential
drivers.search: Motivated when finding value in places others have overlooked
drivers.retrieve: Energy focused on drawing out and realizing possibilities
drivers.reveal: Enjoys bringing discoveries to light and seeing them used by others

thriving_environments: There is much promise and new prospects
Possibility-thinking and ambition are promoted
The culture 'brings out the best in people'
Mentoring, personal and professional growth are highly valued
struggling_environments: There is little investment in training or developing people
Simply refining, reengineering or repositioning is the focus
Seeking and envisioning new possibilities are stifled
top_5.flip_side: Tendency to see the potential in people and possibilities could cause poor investments of resources that never come to fruition.

top_5.name: Demonstrate Learning
top_5.description: Learn how to do something new and to show that you can do it.

drivers.model: Enjoys developing knowledge or skill to proficiency, then demonstrating that proficiency
drivers.practice: Motivated to learn or develop basic skills as quickly as possible
drivers.example: Energy comes from teaching, showing, modeling and living out what learned
drivers.experiment: Always learning new things, trying new things, and doing new things

thriving_environments: Learning and personal growth are essential in the environment
There is application of learning in the work
There is opportunity to present findings and outcomes
There is an opportunity for teaching and modeling
struggling_environments: Where there is less flexibility for change
Where the work is defined and structured
Where individualism isn't highly valued or necessary
Where there is limited ability for promotion and advancement
top_5.flip_side: May feel discontent unless continually learning something new. May experience frustration if others are not open to receiving and adopting things learned.

top_5.name: Persuade
top_5.description: Influence someone's thoughts, feelings or behaviors.

drivers.engage: Engages and influences people (or other living things that can be influenced)
drivers.push: Sensitive to dynamics of behavior and adept at getting through to people
drivers.reactions: Interested in both short-term and long-term responses
drivers.influential: Likes to evoke a change in thoughts, feelings, or behavior

thriving_environments: Sales is a critical component of the company
The flow of interaction and ideas matter
Persuasion is a part of the predominant culture
There is openness to change; allowing for new ways
struggling_environments: A highly established culture and values are not prominent
Mass production and high automation define the business
Process and procedure are the focus
top_5.flip_side: Tendency to focus on response from others could cause overselling ideas and might be distracting to the work. Need to remain self-aware of personal need for a response or feedback.

top_5.name: Make An Impact
top_5.description: Shape and impact the world around you.

drivers.difference: Wants to see a distinct impression or real difference made
drivers.creativity: Desires freedom and control to shape things as seen fit
drivers.connection: Encouraged when seeing change in people's behavior

thriving_environments: The object of products and/or services are people
Bringing a high degree of change is the goal
Individual expression and creativity are welcomed
Vision is ambitious and well-articulated
struggling_environments: The company is focused on tasks and processes
There may not be room for creative freedom and expression
Cannot see immediate or tangible results
top_5.flip_side: Might be subject to over-impacting, over-shaping, trying to make a difference when not needed or required. Could be overly compelled to making the work about self and what is desired.

top_5.name: Improve
top_5.description: Consistently seek to make things better and enhance them.

drivers.lookout: Constantly explores surroundings in search of something to improve
drivers.expert: Will find something to revise, remodel, rearrange, or refine
drivers.skilled: Has extensive skills in a variety of environments
drivers.refine: Has a drive to make things better

thriving_environments: Skills and capabilities are developed
Personal growth is promoted
Things are being brought to new levels of functionality and development
Management is mentoring and investing in employees
struggling_environments: There is a strong sense of tradition and set way of doing things
The products or services are already highly developed
top_5.flip_side: May be critical of existing standards, processes, pushing against the status quo, which may result in stepping on other people's toes with unwanted advice.

strongest.name: Influencer
strongest.description: Energized by inspiring and shaping the world around you and helping others reach their potential. Sees possibilities and opportunities to transform and impact people, products, and outcomes. Seeks to persuade others to join efforts or adopt beliefs as building and creating something from nothing.

blind_spots.when_not_at_best: Desire to persuade and inspire others can come across as overbearing and potentially overshadow others' opinions and ideas. Might focus so much on big ideas that practical implementation steps are overlooked.
blind_spots.advice: Actively listen to and value the perspectives of others, integrating their insights into your vision. Ground inspirational ideas with actionable steps to ensure plans are as practical as they are motivational.

strongest.name: Visionary
strongest.description: Imagination and creativity know no bounds. Driven by the potential of what could be, constantly envisioning and dreaming up new possibilities. Passion for innovation and ability to see beyond the present reality empower bringing transformative ideas to life. Ability to dream big and commitment to making those dreams a reality are greatest strengths.

blind_spots.when_not_at_best: Drive to innovate and push boundaries may cause moving before projects are fully realized and leave a trail of unfinished work. Relentless pursuit of the new can alienate those more invested in practical and immediate results, creating a gap between vision and execution.
blind_spots.advice: Focus on completing current projects before moving to the next big idea to ensure a legacy of tangible achievements. Cultivate partnerships with those who can ground visions with practicality and bridge the gap between ideation and execution.

strongest.name: Relator
strongest.description: Strength lies in ability to forge deep, meaningful connections and to create a sense of unity and collaboration among those around you. Motivated by shared goals and the collective success of team or community. Empathetic nature and genuine concern for others' well-being enable supporting and inspiring those interacted with.

blind_spots.when_not_at_best: Effort to maintain harmony can cause shying away from giving constructive feedback. Tendency to prioritize relationships can result in avoiding difficult but necessary conversations that could lead to significant improvements and deeper connections.
blind_spots.advice: Address conflicts directly and constructively to strengthen relationships and foster personal and professional growth. Balance harmony with honesty, ensuring feedback is given in a supportive and actionable manner.

prompts.description: What gets this person involved and taking action
patterns: Seeing untapped potential in people or situations others have overlooked
Opportunity to learn something new and demonstrate that proficiency
Chance to influence others' thoughts, feelings, or behaviors
Situations where change and impact are needed
Poor experiences that need to be transformed into positive ones
People who need mentoring, guidance, or development
Problems that require innovative solutions

process.description: How this person shows up and does the work
patterns: Learns rapidly and applies knowledge through teaching and modeling
Engages and influences people through relationship and persuasion
Invests in developing others' potential and capabilities
Creates and shapes solutions with freedom and creativity
Continuously improves processes, products, and people
Perseveres through difficulties with determination
Collaborates while maintaining vision and direction

payoffs.description: The ultimate results this person seeks
patterns: Seeing others transformed and reaching their potential
Making a visible, lasting impact on people's lives
Change in behavior and adoption of what has been taught
Others experiencing the ideal through improvements made
Building meaningful relationships and lasting connections
Creating something from nothing that serves others
Recognition through the success of those developed

achievement_stories.title: New Student Orientation Leadership
achievement_stories.summary: Led and shaped the new student orientation program from sophomore through senior year of college, transforming students' lives through mentoring, teaching, and servant leadership.
achievement_stories.situation: As a freshman, experienced a poor orientation program for science majors that lacked the life adjustment support other students received. Protested and got involved to change it for future students.
achievement_stories.what_got_involved: Saw the negative impact of a poor experience and wanted to ensure others didn't have to go through the same thing. Opportunity to transform a broken system and develop people.
achievement_stories.what_did: Led week-long events including field games, outings, and campus tours. Coached students through Gallup Strengths Finder program. Taught semester-long class covering sensitive topics from addiction to diversity. As higher leader, trained student leaders and led service trips to San Francisco. Produced videos for the program covering each topic.
what_made_satisfying: Took poor experience and ensured others didn't have to go through it
Helped students understand what made them unique and how to succeed
Learned how to serve others and made lasting impact on students' lives
Met wife and closest friends through the experience
Formed the basis of who he is today in all aspects of life

achievement_stories.title: Building a Company from Failure
achievement_stories.summary: Started own company during one of the worst periods of personal failure and built it into a successful business with multiple employees, recognized as an industry leader.
achievement_stories.situation: Failed to get into medical school and lost job 4 months before wedding during one of the worst job markets. Had to create own way out of nothing.
achievement_stories.what_got_involved: No opportunities available, everything trained for was falling apart. Had to create something from nothing to survive.
achievement_stories.what_did: Reached out to a Hollywood Fitness trainer and pitched him on an app, which he accepted. Started company, went through pivots and hard times. Grew business organically through word of mouth. Built solutions for largest companies in the world. Traveled the world for work and speaking. Grew to over 20 employees.
what_made_satisfying: At lowest point was able to find way to make something
Shaped company to reflect personal beliefs
Through good work gained reputation as reliable and talented professional
Provides income and lifestyle to support family and employees' families
Gets fulfillment seeing employees accomplish things and go through major milestones

achievement_stories.title: Teaching Sons to Ski
achievement_stories.summary: Taught two sons how to ski, passing along his biggest passion from his father to them, now traveling the world to ski and snowboard together.
achievement_stories.situation: Snowboarding is one of biggest passions, learned from his dad as a kid. When had kids, knew wanted to pass that along to them.
achievement_stories.what_got_involved: Deep desire to share biggest passion and create multi-generational family activity.
achievement_stories.what_did: Started sons at young age, worked with dad to teach them to ski. Over 4.5 years developed them into incredible skiers able to take on terrain all over the mountain. Now starting to travel the world to ski and snowboard together.
what_made_satisfying: Seeing their sense of accomplishment in taking on difficult terrain
Being able to enjoy favorite free time activity with family
Watching dad work with grandchildren and being involved
Family bonding over shared activity that all excel at

achievement_stories.title: Creating Lockr Product
achievement_stories.summary: Identified a need in the industry for complex technology that was out of reach for many, created a product called Lockr, raised investment, obtained 7 worldwide patents, and launched new career opportunities.
achievement_stories.situation: Saw a need for complex technology that was out of reach for many people because of how technical it was. Decided to create a simple solution to a complex issue.
achievement_stories.what_got_involved: Identified potential for simplifying something complex that could impact many people in the industry.
achievement_stories.what_did: Came up with the idea, architected the solution, raised investment money, led team to build and operate it. Obtained 7 worldwide patents.
what_made_satisfying: Took a vision and created it
Beginning to see success from hard work put in over years
Launched many new opportunities in career
Introduced to very close friends and colleagues

effective_approaches: Present opportunities to identify and develop untapped potential in people or situations
Offer chances to learn new things and demonstrate/teach that knowledge
Position as an agent of change who can make lasting impact
Provide freedom and creativity to shape solutions
Connect work to developing and transforming others
Allow persuasion and influence to be part of the process
ineffective_approaches: Offer routine, structured work with no room for innovation
Focus on meeting minimum requirements or compliance
Remove opportunity to teach, mentor, or influence others
Emphasize process and procedure over people and impact
Focus only on finishing tasks without development of people
Isolate from meaningful relationships and collaboration

key_appeals: Opportunity to see and develop potential others have missed
Chance to learn and then teach/model new skills
Platform to influence and change people's lives
Freedom to create and innovate for impact

how_to_negotiate_with.approach: Build a narrative around shared values and visions, creating a compelling story that resonates with aspirations to impact and inspire. Highlight opportunities for growth, learning, and discovery. Emphasize potential for building stronger relationships and fostering team unity.
how_to_negotiate_with.avoid: Don't position as process-focused or compliance-oriented. Don't minimize impact on people or development opportunities. Don't emphasize rigid structure over creativity and innovation.

preferences: Relationally warm with genuine concern for others
Focused on developing potential in people and situations
likely_to_dismiss: Tasks without clear impact on people
Roles without learning or teaching opportunities
Work that stifles creativity and innovation

will_look_for: Can I identify and develop untapped potential?
Will I learn new things and be able to teach/demonstrate them?
Can I influence and change people's lives?
Is there freedom to create and innovate?
Will I make a lasting, visible impact?
Are there meaningful relationships and collaboration?
when_asked_about_new_opportunity.will_be_drawn_to: Opportunities to discover potential, learn and teach, influence change, and make lasting impact on people through creative, relational work
when_asked_about_new_opportunity.will_avoid: Structured, process-focused work without impact on people, learning opportunities, or creative freedom

typical_process: Look for untapped potential or overlooked value in the situation
Learn what's needed and develop proficiency quickly
Engage and influence key people through relationship
Create innovative solutions with freedom to shape the approach
Develop others along the way through teaching and modeling
Measure success by impact on people's lives

when_facing_setback.likely_response: Will persevere through difficulties (Overcome at 9.2). May become frustrated if unable to see impact or influence change. Could struggle if learning or teaching opportunities are blocked. Might push too hard to persuade when others aren't receptive.

high_priority: Identifying and developing potential in people and situations
Learning new things and demonstrating/teaching them
Making lasting impact and influencing change
Creative freedom to shape and improve
low_priority: Finishing tasks for their own sake
Recognition separate from impact on others

notable_patterns.unique_insight: Chris has three motivations tied at 9.7 (Demonstrate Learning, Persuade, Make An Impact) all feeding into his top motivation of Identify Potential (10.0). This creates a powerful Influencer-Visionary-Relator core where finding potential, developing it through learning and teaching, and influencing lasting change are inseparable. His achievement stories consistently show transforming negative situations into positive impact on others' lives.
notable_patterns.emotional_signature: Deep satisfaction comes from seeing transformation in othersâ€”students finding their identity, employees reaching milestones, family bonding over shared accomplishments. Recognition comes through the success of those developed rather than personal accolades. The phrase 'it formed the basis of who I am today' reveals how deeply integrated impact on others is to his identity.
notable_patterns.collaboration_style: Highly relational and collaborative (Collaborate at 8.9), but from a development and influence perspective rather than pure teamwork. Prefers to lead through teaching, modeling, and mentoring rather than directive authority. Creates lasting bonds with those he developsâ€”'some of my closest friends even 20 years later are still others I led with.'
